headline.main: Study Links Respiratory Illness To Use of Gas Stoves in Homes; Pre-School Difference

docs.lead_paragraph: DURHAM, N. C. -- Studies made by the Environmental Protection Agency have yielded "preliminary" indications that people who live in homes with gas stoves are more susceptible to respiratory ailments than people who use other cooking devices.
docs.snippet: DURHAM, N. C. -- Studies made by the Environmental Protection Agency have yielded "preliminary" indications that people who live in homes with gas stoves are more susceptible to respiratory ailments than people who use other cooking devices.
